website_summaries.verdict: A great option for a standard controller for your Nintendo Switch that offers long battery life.
pros: Features a classic game controller layout and has a rechargeable battery that provides 11 to 19 hours of continuous play time when fully charged
Can be used while charging as well
Also compatible with Windows and Android
cons: Not compatible with amiibo and can't wake up the Switch console

customer_reviews.title: Great control so far.
customer_reviews.text: Feels great. It was decently easy to set up. Great for Mario cart. Doesn't work with Mario party but that was my fault for not reading that Mario party requires the little non pro controllers. Can't wait to use them with smash. Sticks feel good and come with a hard grip cover. Has decent weight. Charges with USB c. Buttons feel pretty solid.
customer_reviews.author: Branden

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your Buck
customer_reviews.text: So I used this controller for about 25 hours. The material could feel a bit better. Maybe some rubber grips on for where the palms fit. The Dpad and joysticks felt a little loose for my taste. The abyx buttons have a good feel to them. The triggers are decent. The Gyro work's ok but I did not use it much. Overall it's a good controller for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Durressed

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Overall it's a great quality controller i bought for fortnite, it helped enhance my gameplay for Nintendo Switch and it takes a short time to connect, good battery life too. Hope that helps before you spend your money.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Carlos Herrera

customer_reviews.title: feels light and cheap
customer_reviews.text: So it feels light like really light and cheap. It is not. I've dropped it a good few times now and it works great still. The battery has lasted 3 weeks now. I play 1-2hrs every two days so moderate use. The longest play time was 14 hrs over two days before having to recharge (breath of the wild). DO NOT lose the instructios on how to pair. Once paired you only need to hold the button down for 2 seconds and it will load up. Now if you use the joy cons in between uses then you need to re pair it. You go into controllers then the grip order.
customer_reviews.author: a b

customer_reviews.title: Poor durability
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is great, and the controller feels good in the hands. Easy to connect, never any troubles. [Update after 1 year of use] After a year of use, some of the buttons have started to stick. I'm not a heavy gamer, I don't even play my switch every week and often I play portable. So I wouldn't say I'm hard on the controller. I opened it up to make sure it was just dirty, and I found that the rubber pad has worn out. I'm really disappointed that this controller couldn't even last year with light to moderate use.
customer_reviews.author: Gtgrier

customer_reviews.title: Not even worth a try, avoid it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this controller since it was featured in an article as the best alternative to the name brand pro controller. However it has been out of stock for ages and now that it is in stock, it is NOT the controlled that was reviewed or even the same controller. Notice the reviews of black controller (SG-N30)? The white version (SG-H510) has raised buttons that are completely useless. Avoid this!!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Shedlock

customer_reviews.title: I prefer this over my powerA controller
customer_reviews.text: I have this and a powerA controller. I prefer to use this one. I love that it is rechargeable and uses USB-C to charge. It does report the battery life to the switch which is awesome. Setup was simple and easy. It connects back easily every time I use it. The only improvement I would make would be to rubberize the hand grips. Outside of that great controller.
customer_reviews.author: Scotty H.

customer_reviews.title: Not paying 60$ for nintendo pro controller
customer_reviews.text: Works with the nintendo switch, you can use it wirelessly or plugged into the usb port. I didn't use the red caps it came with because the make the joy sticks a little to high for my fingers. The buttons are soft clicky unlike the switch joycons witch are hard clicky. The motion control works fine too. I don't know if it's just my controller, but sometimes it will automatically disconnect from the switch and i have to reset it.
customer_reviews.author: dorsey ingram

customer_reviews.title: Charging Cable not included
customer_reviews.text: Haven't gotten to actually use controller yet bc charging cable (USB-C) is not included. Had to purchase separately which is annoying and means the controller is effectively $10 more than price advertised if you don't have spare USB-C cables. Would not recommend for people with large hands. The contour of this controller makes it awkward to reach the B button. Otherwise, it is lightweight and comfortable to hold.
customer_reviews.author: T m L

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic controller for a fantastic price.
customer_reviews.text: Overall this controller is amazing. Its battery life lasts all day (even up for weeks) depending on the usage but never you would be let down by it: you can forget about battery life as it never seems to end. The only downside is that it can feel cheap and doesn't have Ammiibo support. If you press the back triggers hard and fast enough they will squeak (as I noticed on many cheap controllers). But all-in-all, you can use this to add more players cheaply, play with non-time-based games or just have something enjoyable for an affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: Shadd

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of issue with this controller
customer_reviews.text: I really like the design of this controller and it is really sleek. One thing I like to point out is the faulty control stick calibration when sometimes the dot doesn't stay in the middle even tho the controller isn't drifting. I like to play with rumble on but this controller makes me feel like I have Parkinson's disease. So I had to disable it because it wasn't pleasant. Overall I think this controller still need to be worked on and add particular function like HD Rumble.
customer_reviews.author: ZeKiKun

customer_reviews.title: Great price and feel with packed feature
customer_reviews.text: For the price? This is great! I used it for my PC Battery life and ergonomics is great. Only slight issue is the buttons don’t have best feeling when pressed. The trigger sway to the left and right by few millimeters. Not a big deal though.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great quality. Sticks go back center, no drift!
customer_reviews.text: Decent priced alternative to other PC controllers, not to mention it looks great, unlike the weird designs that personally turn me off. Sturdy and well-made, it has heft but not enough to tire your hand. The buttons take some getting used to, but they're far more responsive than an analog controller. Set your Deadzone to 0 on FPS games because the sticks go right back to center, no drift (so far). I use this wired so I have not tried the Bluetooth connection yet. My only gripe is the X/Y and A/B buttons are backwards. It looks almost identical to an Xbox controller so that takes some getting used to.
customer_reviews.author: Shawnus

customer_reviews.title: Best controller I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: This controller surpasses all of my expectations. It connects to your PC, Nintendo Switch, Android device, or iOS device. I personally use it for my PC and Switch. It works flawlessly with zero noticeable input delay. The construction feels like quality. Yes it's plastic and its design is simplistic but it feels sturdy and the mechanics of it feel very premium. Definitely pleased with it and I'll be looking into what other products this manufacturer makes.
customer_reviews.author: Nathanial V.

customer_reviews.title: excellent value in a pro style controller for the Switch
customer_reviews.text: read a lot of reviews before picking this controller. it has an excellent feel. buttons and sticks are firm not sloppy like some 3rd party controllers. USB C charging is nice since that what all our family phones use so we have lots of chargers around. Battery life is decent. Only issue (which I knew before I bought it) is that it won't wake the switch.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S.

customer_reviews.title: I've seen better build quality for $30. Overall it's a decent controller.
customer_reviews.text: Product works great so far. You can rearrange the buttons just like a mechanical keyboard. Feels like a mechanical keyboard. Nice ergonomics, and very lightweight. Build quality is a little suspect. Kind of a flimsy feel to it. You can flex the controller pretty easily.
customer_reviews.author: Mari

customer_reviews.title: What the third party controller standard should be
customer_reviews.text: A unique controller for $30 that checks off all the boxes for what I wanted in a controller. It's very comfortable and feels great when clicking any of the buttons. Only complaint is that the plastic feels a bit cheap on the whole controller but I like the appeal of it since it still feels solid and it won't break. Works great on the Fire Stick TV and Windows 10.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME ALTERNATIVE!
customer_reviews.text: Love the build and quality of this controller. It's responsive and it vibrates! It was hard to find an alternative to the Nintendo Switch Pro controller that vibrates yet I came across this one and it's half the price of the pro controller.
customer_reviews.author: Sloan Sheppard

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't connect to anything at all
customer_reviews.text: I tried this on a PC, a Mac and an iPad. Nothing I could do could get it to connect and if it did, there were way too many complications between the systems I was using, those of the individual games and the controller itself.
customer_reviews.author: Mark H

customer_reviews.title: Best Pro Controller for Smash Bros!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after seeing a Spawn Wave YouTube video about it. There are only two downfalls. 1. No amiibo support 2. Can't turn the switch on by pressing the home button. For me both of those are not that important. This has a better rumble than the Nintendo Pro Controller does. It's also very responsive. Best pro controller to play fighting games with. I win Smash tournaments with this controller.
customer_reviews.author: Robshameless

customer_reviews.title: Feels cheap and breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: My husband did a lot of research before purchasing this Pro Controller for our Nintendo Switch. In my opinion it feels very cheap in my hands. After less than a month of use we are extremely disappointed that the x button broke off! I would return this item if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Bertystevens

customer_reviews.title: it is one of the best Controller I have gotten.
customer_reviews.text: I been using this remote for about a couple months now. I love that I can use this remote on any device that I would like to use. The size is pretty good but I wish it was a little more bulkier. The other that a great controller battery lasts forever and I love using it for my gaming. Pause on top of all that I bought it had pretty cheap price to. Some making it one of the best controllers I use all the time
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: I've bought three.
customer_reviews.text: I like this controller alot with just a few issues. I love how smooth all the buttons and triggers are. The battery life for me so far is on par with regular controllers. The problems iv had are buttons sometimes pop out but are easy to put back in place. The weight of the controller is very light and can take a minute to get used to. Pairing is easy through bluetooth and I have had no problems with lag.
customer_reviews.author: south

customer_reviews.title: Mistake
customer_reviews.text: Seriously a piece of garbage, triggers have no click to them like they are just on some type of spring. The layout of the buttons and the way they stick out is bizarre and also have no click, nothing on the controller does. It has worked well with Bluetooth and the battery life is really good. So good software with garbage hardware, spend the extra $20 for something usable
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Coomer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the buy, don’t buy for competitive use
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good controller for casual use, do not buy if you plan to play competitively in any capacity. The motion controls work fine along with the base rumble, works with splatoon with the gyro just missing nfc worth the buy but is a mess to connect to a console
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Tougas

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a whole 2 hrs
customer_reviews.text: Buttons and sticks stopped working after two hours of first use. Still charges. Can still connect. Anything else NADA
customer_reviews.author: nada name

customer_reviews.title: Cool unique must have for Nintendo Switch fans
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to sync with Nintendo switch , no problems there but the rumble is way to strong and loud the RL and LL feel weird but They still respond well. It’s a cool controller Hope they upgrade the rumble and make a black version.
customer_reviews.author: neal

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly with my son's Nintendo Switch.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly with my son's Nintendo Switch. No issues over using the default controllers and I love having the bigger controller to play Mario Kart with.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry N.

customer_reviews.title: Mechanical buttons have too much travel and prevent finger sliding from one to the other.
customer_reviews.text: This controller really peaked my interest but I was ultimately disappointed. Magnet shoulder triggers and mechanical buttons sounded nice but the controller doesn't quite deliver. The buttons require long travel before they register and the shoulder buttons do not have a satisfying click. It is also impossible to slide your finger from one button to the next do to the mechanical nature.
customer_reviews.author: Michael V. Praino

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this.
customer_reviews.text: This thing keeps losing Bluetooth connection to my Nintendo switch. Only controller that does this sitting in the same spots in the house playing the same games with friends. It’s embarrassing when you’re playing Super Smash Bro’s and all you do is randomly walk off cliffs and interrupt everyone because it disconnects.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Darnell

customer_reviews.title: Controller stopped charging after two months
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item on May 2nd, 2019 and the battery already stopped keeping its charge. Tried using different outlets, different switch charging cords and nothing worked. I then tried to contact Amazon technical support to report the issue and they were not helpful at all. They also said the controller cannot be returned. Has a 1 month return policy. So do yourself a favor, save your money and buy a controller that has a warranty or longer return policy.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J. Benn

customer_reviews.title: Please Don’t Buy This. Seriously.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for Ultimate. Control sticks reach about 40% tilt even when thrown hard into the side of their housing. Triggers are wonky and the whole controller feels about as cheap as they come. Light like a bad steak. Don’t buy this. It’s not viable for anything but Mario Party and wasting 30$. You should just buy a Pro controller or a nice GameCube adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: It works perfectly, pairs easily, and the price is WAY more digestible than the official Pro pad. Having a dpad instead of two sticks is the icing.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Ours died pretty shortly :(
customer_reviews.text: We really liked it until it suddenly died completely for no aparently reason.
customer_reviews.author: Kellogg Family

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality. Functional, and very well priced! Best 3rd party wireless Switch controller out there
customer_reviews.text: Amazing controller! This thing works with the Switch, Windows PC, Mac, Linux, and Android! The controller feels premium and all the buttons and thumbsticks are A+. They feel good, solid, and are very responsive. I wish the seller would have a bundle to purchase two of these or offer a discount for multiple controller purchases though.
customer_reviews.author: A.C.

customer_reviews.title: It is not very good
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item on October 23. At first it was pretty good, but after a 1 month and a half the button commands did not work. I would press a button and it would take 2 seconds to work. The joystick also had some problems. I would constantly push it just for it to work 1 time. I would suggest no one to order this product and settle for a Nintendo pro controller or a game cube controller.
customer_reviews.author: Tai Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Works Great; some buttons are mushy
customer_reviews.text: Actually amazing for a cheaper controller. However, the d-pad is all one button (playing Tetris is almost impossible), and the shoulder LR buttons are mushy. Other than that, it's great. The included thumb grips improved life a great deal as well.
customer_reviews.author: smarble

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok, a bit laggy on wireless
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad controller, good for the price I guess. It lags when using it wirelessly, you can’t definitely feel the difference in response time when switching from joycons to this. But there is no lag when using it hard wired. Also a great controller for pc. Wouldn’t recommend for serious or competitive gaming where timing is important. But it’s not terrible enough to return so I’ll live with it.
customer_reviews.author: LatrentC

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS...quit wasting your time and money on others
customer_reviews.text: I decided to buy this amazing controller because both sets of Nintendo Switch brand controllers developed a "ghost walk" after a year of use (i play RPGs... in other words, non-aggressive game play). No regrets. The battery lasts weeks Its lightweight and sturdy Comfortable grip and great snap to buttons I would give it 6 star if possible
customer_reviews.author: thomas jacob frost III

customer_reviews.title: Heh
customer_reviews.text: A CONTROLLER THAT DOES WHAT IT DESCRIBES , VERY NICE SLEEK DESIGN A+ YOU CAN'T GO WRONG WITH A FUNCTIONALITY THAT Offers 3x The Experience as Well , Get it it's Very comfortable Would buy from them again
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: Does what’s needed
customer_reviews.text: Setup is easy plug in and wait for all the cord could be longer or not a different size than a micro usb
customer_reviews.author: anon1234567890987

customer_reviews.title: 3 differences between this and the official
customer_reviews.text: One of the best controller for 30 or under. Surprisingly lightweight compared to the nintendo official pro con
customer_reviews.author: Bruno

customer_reviews.title: Great budget alternative pro controller.
customer_reviews.text: Just got this controller and it feels exactly like the pro controller for a fraction of the price. I would buy it agIn if i needed another at least based on my initial experience.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Bricked in the middle of firmware update. Maybe just a fluke. Returned for a refund.
customer_reviews.text: Bricked in the middle of firmware update. Maybe just a fluke. Returned for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good iPad Game Controller
customer_reviews.text: Good quality! Buttons are a little different than expected and A/B and X/Y are in mirrored positions than normal but over all good product.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Great wired controller.
customer_reviews.text: This product had some input lag when I played Super Smash Brothers or Rocket League wirelessly on the Nintendo Switch. When I played Rocket League on PC (wired) it worked like a charm! Decent controller depending on your needs.
customer_reviews.author: Lee C.

customer_reviews.title: It’s pretty good
customer_reviews.text: It feels a bit hollow but there’s some weight to it. All in all, pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: dalemau5

customer_reviews.title: Great value alternative to the Nintendo controller
customer_reviews.text: The battery life is great. The weight of the controller feels a little light but is otherwise comfortable. The stick covers are nice but I don't use them because they add too much bulk.
customer_reviews.author: D.Farls

customer_reviews.title: Very solid and meets expectations but still too soon to tell
customer_reviews.text: The remote itself is solid only had it for two days so review could change but battery life is insane has yet to even get to half after 4 hours of playing. Comfortable and a bit smaller just a tiny bit smaller than the dual shock 4. Snycs to switch very quickly might make an update after 2 months if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: Nicklaus Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time
customer_reviews.text: Does not work at all. I bought it for my Firestick in which I downloaded some classic games on it but unfortunately it didn't work!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Dan Reyna

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for myself and my boyfriend stole it from me! He loves the feel and function, it’s a super awesome controller!
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Strong

customer_reviews.title: Well Built and Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: Gamepad came in on time and well packaged. The gamepad felt well built and sturdy. At $30 it's a great price. Anyone familiar with wireless Xbox controllers, they know $30 is a steal. The one thing it was missing for me is on the RB and LB buttons as they just click and don't have different positions.
customer_reviews.author: Griffen Stephenson

customer_reviews.title: This was weird
customer_reviews.text: This is really weird, we played all games and worked. When we played smash the controller worked for a few minutes then just switches, we tested so many things, but the problem is so unknown and weird.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Fernández

customer_reviews.title: Economical
customer_reviews.text: Great for phone connecting to the games. the kids love this controller it worked well with Apple TV and Nintendo Switch, other devices we did not have to try it out but this was a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Dominique

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Kids play with it everyday and it hasn’t broke lol
customer_reviews.author: Veronica cervantes

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Damn thing works great, except the kids fight to get it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Good linux game pad
customer_reviews.text: Works very good with my Fedora installation. Feels a little cheap but for the price is good. Good support and they shipped a replacement right away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good idea but need improved design
customer_reviews.text: I like it but the side grips need to be shorter since its hard to get to the buttons
customer_reviews.author: David V.

customer_reviews.title: Does what it was bought to do!
customer_reviews.text: My son had enjoyed using this product for his gaming
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Better than the pro controller, quality feels the same. This one comes with these red joystick caps
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Fairly good
customer_reviews.text: The controller is good except the Joysticks aren't the quickest in response (I think). I say i think due to the fact that in smash I can't dash dance. This is not a good smash controller
customer_reviews.author: Alex K.

customer_reviews.title: Stick Malfunction
customer_reviews.text: This controller has a malfunction regarding the control sticks. The right stick moves up without me touching it, and calibration does not affect this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is the second off brand controller I’ve purchased and this one works PERFECT. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Greg Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: No complaints. Great alternative to the official pro controller. Was really pleasantly surprised by how good it is for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Kareem M.

customer_reviews.title: Joystick delays
customer_reviews.text: Everything about the controller aside from the sticks is fine. The joysticks seemed very unresponsive or had a delay when playing. This makes it difficult to use with any accuracy in a game like smash ultimate.
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, great response and easy to connect
customer_reviews.text: This control is so good! Love the design. Battery life is great. Easy to pair to nintendo switch. The controls are very responsive. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Roberto C.

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This controller is well built, the buttons and sticks have a good, solid feel. It's about the same size as an xb1 controller, but weighs less. Has solid rumble as well.
customer_reviews.author: Keven Marsh

customer_reviews.title: Great pro controller especially for the money.
customer_reviews.text: My one quirk with this controller is how easy it is to press the thumb stick buttons accidentally.
customer_reviews.author: Rashad M

customer_reviews.title: Power shortage
customer_reviews.text: I was enthusiastic about getting the pro controller but just me having it only for one day nd not even a full day i charged it nd it keeps turning off nd i have to reconnect it
customer_reviews.author: Sherman Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Best controller by far for the price, great quality and responsiveness. The four face buttons could be a little more snappy feeling
customer_reviews.author: Robert Wiles

customer_reviews.title: An Average Controller for Bargain-Seekers
customer_reviews.text: The controller works well enough. It’s battery life could be better though. It’s overall a decent controller that gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Mayo

customer_reviews.title: Massive input lag on super smash bros ultimate but decent on other games
customer_reviews.text: Looks cheap feels cheap and is cheap you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: Matmanthebatman

customer_reviews.title: I think it’s very solid
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good. exactly what I wanted out of a controller
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect opportunity to the pro controller
customer_reviews.text: Very strong and well made. Great battery life & feels great to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob E

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: i love its great quality worth every penny and as good a pro controller
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Skoog

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son to use with his Nintendo switch. Haven’t had any complaints about it.
customer_reviews.author: Hue T.

customer_reviews.title: Sticks are faulty
customer_reviews.text: Any time I used the right stick it wouldn't go or down.
customer_reviews.author: carnu

product_meta.title: Sunwaytek H510 Mechanical Pro Controller for Nintendo Switch, PC, Android, iOS, Linux
feature_bullets: MULTI-PLATFORM -- Compatible with Nintendo Switch/NSL, Windows (incl. Steam), Android, Apple devices, Fire TV, etc, you’ll get more than just an alternative to Switch Pro Controller
DIFFERENT -- Mechanical keyswitch for ABXY delivers unrivaled speedy, smooth linear feel(NOT CLICKY); Patented arcade stick like D-pad is intuitive and comfortable you never felt on gamepad

DURABLE -- Leading brand components are adopted, like ALPS stick controller for thumb sticks, for stable performance; No use of rubber dome for all buttons which is easy to get worn out shortly but still widely used in other controllers
SIMPLE -- Delicate to pure gaming experience staying with core features incl. motion sensor, analog triggers, rumble, rechargeable battery, free you from fussy functions and messy setups
SUPPORTIVE -- Easy to find us on the official website for all your concerns over the product life span, quick help is guaranteed along the way till satisfaction

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars311 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
